import React from 'react'; const Site = () => { const skillsDataset = [ // Frontend Skills { category: "Frontend", title: "JavaScript", level: 90 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "React.js", level: 85 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "HTML5", level: 90 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "CSS3", level: 85 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "HTML5", level: 95 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "CSS", level: 100 }, { category: "Frontend", title: "Figma", level: 90 }, // Backend Skills { category: "Backend", title: "Java", level: 90 }, { category: "Backend", title: "C", level: 75 }, { category: "Backend", title: "Python", level: 65 }, { category: "Backend", title: "TypeScript", level: 70 }, { category: "Backend", title: "R", level: 80 }, { category: "Backend", title: "MySQL", level: 85 }, { category: "Backend", title: "React-Native", level: 85 }, // Note: React-Native can be used for mobile (frontend) or backend { category: "Backend", title: "FastAPI", level: 60 }, { category: "Backend", title: "JSON", level: 90 }, { category: "Backend", title: "Node.js", level: 90 }, // Common Skills (Tools and Practices) { category: "Common", title: "Postman", level: 80 }, { category: "Common", title: "Git", level: 95 }, { category: "Common", title: "Linux", level: 70 }, ]; return (

Site coding 나의 작업물

{skillsDataset.map((skill, key) => (
{key + 1}.
{skill.category}
{skill.title}
{`Level: ${skill.level}`}
))}
); }; export default Site;
